p: Both Aedes and Culex females caught in summer 2018 with the resting trap had higher mean sugar content than their male counterparts. Additionally, female Cx. quinquefasciatus caught in summer with an aspirator had the highest mean sugar content at 50.79 ± 19.52 µg ( Table 2). Culex quinquefasciatus captured by CDC resting traps had significantly more sugar content than those captured by BGS2 for females (CDC resting: 23.86 ± 8.00 µg vs BGS2: 13.73 ± 3.21 µg; P = 0.0094) but not for males (CDC resting: 7.19 ± 1.85 µg vs BGS2: 13.60 ± 2.90 µg; P = 0.4109) ( Fig. 6). The mean sugar content for female Ae. aegypti was higher for specimens captured by resting traps and aspirator than for specimens captured by BGS2, although the difference was not statistically significant ( P = 0.2761).
